title: Strategies for Overcoming Barriers to Reading Mathematical Academic English Texts for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English reading comprehension, foundational understanding of mathematical concepts (binary operations, functions, statistics, etc.), and recognition of simple mathematical terminology (mean, variable, equation)
context.additional_context: Focuses on reading academic mathematics texts (research papers, theoretical explanations) to recognize limitations of translation-centered reading strategies and improve meaning-centered reading through contextual understanding. Emphasizes mathematical thinking tools such as **proof structures**, **graph-equation correlations**, and **statistical data interpretation**

learning_goals: Learners can apply ≥3 strategies (graph analysis, formula interpretation, technical term inference) to comprehend contextual meanings in mathematical academic texts.
Learners can analyze math-specific terminology (e.g., theorem, variable, proof) and complex sentence structures (conditional clauses, relative clauses) to extract core concepts.
Learners can reduce translation dependency by ≥50% and practice reading methods based on mathematical context inference (e.g., equation-graph relationships, statistical data interpretation).
Learners can reflect on their reading comprehension processes (especially mathematical argument structures) based on peer feedback and develop improvement plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
